normalised: Question: What are some things you should know before traveling on Indian Railways?
Traveling by train in India is an experience! It's a great way to see the country, but it’s good to be prepared. Here are some things you should keep in mind to make your journey smoother.

unnormalised: **Question: What are some things you should know before traveling on Indian Railways?**
normalised: First off, booking tickets. I-R-C-T-C’s website or app is your go-to. Tatkal bookings open one day prior to the journey (excluding the date of travel). So, if you’re traveling on twenty sixth October two thousand and twenty four, Tatkal opens on twenty fifth October two thousand and twenty four. A-C classes open at ten A-M, and sleeper class at eleven A-M. Be quick; seats vanish fast! Also, keep your P-N-R number handy (it's a ten digit number usually). This will help you track the status of your ticket. You can check your P-N-R status on the I-R-C-T-C website or through various third-party apps. Many trains operate at full capacity and the possibility of R-A-C (Reservation Against Cancellation) tickets is pretty high. Be aware of this before planning your journey.

Then there's Chair Car (C-C) for daytime travel. three A offers good value for money and is generally clean. Sleeper is the most common class, but it can get crowded. General class is the most basic and usually unreserved. The train number can be like one two zero zero one or two two eight one nine. Keep an eye out for this on the platform display boards. If you are booking tickets in a train for three A, the ticket cost between Delhi and Mumbai can be about rupee one thousand five hundred.

normalised: Food is another thing. Many long-distance trains have pantry cars. You can also order food online through I-R-C-T-C’s e-catering service or apps like RailYatri. Veg and non-veg options are usually available. Alternatively, pack your own snacks and water. Chai (tea) vendors are common on most trains, shouting "Chai, chai!" every few minutes. Each cup of chai costs around rupee ten. Be careful about buying food from unauthorized vendors to avoid any health issues. The expiry date of the food packets should be checked carefully.
